Hey buddy. These tcmalloc notices come from NMS function when there are too many bounding boxes, it‚Äôs a low memory warning. This probably means your images are generating 10,000 or more false positives. This can happen when you use focal loss for example, as it pushes the system towards detecting objects and away from correctly identifying empty areas (true negatives). <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ChristopherSTAN>@ChristopherSTAN</denchmark-link> sure. It looks like from your screenshot you are also reaching an NMS timeout. There is a 10.0 second maximum limit on NMS operations for a batch, after this it will to the next batch. I put this in place to prevent super long testing times in cases such as yours. Maybe there is a better way to handle this, I'm not sure. One way to avoid this is to use python train.py --notest, which will avoid testing until the last epoch. Often these effects are transient and only occur in the very early stages of training.
